messages.message: @Xindi Xu can you help me get access to this? I don't think I have the credentials
@Xindi Xu tried adding a member to nCino and I'm getting access denied. Did we do anything to break permissions/links?
If/when we get this working, if someone could add me to nCino that would be amazing:the_horns: We have a post-sales kick off with them tomorrow afternoon UK time so need to get them setup on the org
I'll follow up with the team today. @Hamish can't the nCino folks send you an invite to join?

@Hamish I sent you an invite at <mailto:hamish.campbell+ncino@instabase.com|hamish.campbell+ncino@instabase.com>

For future reference, when logging in as a site admin you need to click "here" to first enable some no PII mode, then you can go to settings to add users. Directly accessing the links below won't work (still block by permission). Xindi -- we should probably just remove the links in the bulletpoints to avoid confusion.

@hannah while you are in the UK :slightly_smiling_face: would be good to know who in sales that we can make as site admin that they can help adding users to commercial orgs instead of having to wait for Eng

Ah that's right - I forgot to press "here" first! Out of curiosity, how is this gated @Xindi Xu? If we can tied this to "Manage AI Hub" permission instead of site admin we can enable our saleseng team here to help manage this wihtou having to make them site admins
Thanks @Kerry. Could someone make me an admin? Lee is OOO and the other contact as nCino we don't work with anymore

Just checked. The portal itself is accessible by users with `manage_aihub` site acl. However, they can't access all the actions because in the backend, we are still checking for site admin bit for those actions.
